author: Elisa Motterle
text:
I seldom leave negative reviews, but in this case i feel I need to WARN potential buyers.
.
My husband bought an expensive watch for me on site (upon my suggestion, i regret).  The watch came with a certification stating that it was original and in pristine working condition.
.
Circa 20 days passed from the moment he received the watch to the moment I was given it, unpacked it and realized it was NOT working.
.
I claimed with Client Service only to hear that since than longer than 14 had passed, they were not willing to take any responsibility.
And, I was dismissed quite rudely.
.
So, I wonder: what is the certification the watch came with for? Certifications provided by VC clearly hold NO VALUE to Vestiaire in the first place, and this speaks volumes about their trustworthiness.
.
On top of this, client service itself is really sloppy; you never get to speak with anybody, just emails that are clearly pre-written...AND scammy messages "reply withing xx hours or we'll archive your case".
.
I had the WORST experience, I usually don't like to speak ill but in this case I feel I need to warn you to to steer clear of vestiaire. 
.
All they have is good marketing, but service is inexistent... Which came just as a surprise, as having been a seller in the past, I am painfully aware of the high commission they command.
.
They'll never see any of me or my family again and I will discourage all the people I know.
I'm a big fan of second hand and I never had such a negative experience so far.
title: WORST experience - AVOID for your own good

author: Laura Buadas
text:
A terrible experience!. I am still waiting for my payment.
I sold a CDior saddle bag, limited edition, for 1.800E. When it came to payment they sent me an email saying that for security reasons they had blocked my account and that they wanted proof of my address.
I have been receiving payments from them before, I actually have sold 5 items and I have been labelled by them as an expert seller.
I cannot provide them with the documents they are asking from since I temporarily live in a new country and the address on my commodity bills doesnt coincide with the address in my passport. In this case their automatic system where you have to upload the docs doesnt accept a purchase bill. I did sent one from Decathlon, proving where I am staying right now. My mobile bill is from my previous country and obviously doesnt coincide with my passport either. They have no right to ask me that my address coincides with my passport or my bills, I move around a do change my address quite often. In fact I am going to live off-grid next month and I wont have gas or tel bills no more.
So they have built a security system that fails and it is illegit but I have to pay the price for it because when it comes to complains they make everything really difficult, a labyrith, so you give up. They redirect also every complain to a help center and in my case its been a month and they have not even answer, on top they dont give you a case reference number when you put the complain.
They keep on sending me an automatic email, with a non-reply, asking for these documents, as it is my fault and the ball is on my roof.
I have asked to at least get my handbag back with no success.

Laura B. Rotger
Greece
title: A terrible experience!. They owe me 1.500E

author: Vasso
text: Shipping fees to be applied is one thing. But there should be some transparency here. There is a whole section in customer service that displays the shipping fees at each case, depending on the buyer's and seller's location or the type of shipping you chose. What's the point of these tables if the fees you really have to pay have nothing to do with them. I purchased 2 items over the last 2 weeks. One from an EU country to Greece and one from Greece to Greece. At both times I was asked to pay the exact same amount of 11€ for shipping fees while at the relative link mentions 10€ for shipping in the EU and 6€ for local shipping. That's not right. There is a "from" next to the shipping rate. Does this justify it all? I searched for anything that could explain such an amount and the only thing I could find was customs which of course don't apply within the same country. 11€ is too expensive for local shipping. There should be clarity and there should be some sort of customer service. I contacted customer service and they told me sorry nothing I can do. It's not about the amount of money you have to pay. It's about trust and consistency. I was a big fan of Vestiaire but I don't think I'll ever buy from there again.
title: Shipping fees to be applied is one thing

author: Sarah A
text:
**UPDATE** I am officially $600 out of pocket and no attempt by VC to resolve. Just a stock standard reply from a customer care agent.

As a long time eBay customer and professional seller, I have to express my utter disappointment with the service received from Vestiaire. 

I purchased a Chanel handbag on the proviso that Vestiaire would take care of me should anything go wrong with the transaction. The bag was listed in the ‘very good condition’ category which I soon realised is not at the grading standards one would expect when buying Chanel. 

The bag arrived with visible oxidisation on the chain strap which was NOT declared by the seller. The bag also arrived without a serial number (!!) which too was NOT declared by the seller. 

I reported both issues to Vestiaire and sent supporting photos to which they agreed to reassess the bag a second time.

After I had to follow up 3 times to get an update, I was informed the bag was fine and that I wouldn’t be refunded. Vestiaire’s explanation was that it is a very old bag and was produced before serial numbers existed. Wouldn’t one think that this vital piece of information should be declared on the listing? Even the quality of the photos that Vestiaire approved left much to be desired.

Vestiaire then proceeded to relist the bag on my account without informing me first and it was sold for hundreds of dollars less than what I had paid. So the poor customer who is now buying this bag (and may not care about the issues I’ve highlighted), may end up with a cancelled sale because of poor communication on VC’s end. Either that or VC will proceed with the sale against my wishes and I am left hundreds of dollars out of pocket.

I had to go through the exhausting task of contacting their customer service team for the umpteenth time via chat (which if you have done this before, you will know requires much patience and effort as you never get to chat to the same person twice and have to explain the entire situation over), only to have them pass on my message to another member of the team, to then get back to me via email. No opportunity to have a two way dialogue because of a very poor customer service platform.

So here I am, trying to figure out how on earth to move forward after spending many hours without a resolution. I’ve had to escalate my issue to PayPal.

My honest opinion is not to waste your time and energy, the service is sub par and you are treated like a number.

Do better Vestiaire, your customers deserve better.
title: Disappointing to say the least
